content.description: Start in the middle of the west face trending right. This is granite with sloping holds and sharp crimps.
content.location:
It is on the opposite side of

Party Trick

on the Apparatus Boulder. The estimated GPS location 39°56'43.31"N 105°20'51.93"W.

content.description:
This is a great line just to the left of

West Face

(V0). Start in two small but positive pockets, using an undercling and some tricky footwork to gain the high quarter pad crimp. Pull hard, and get your feet high before gunning for the big ledge. One final committing move to the lip will see you through this sweet problem.
content.protection: A pad or two. It's a long but safe fall if you blow the last move.
content.location:
The route is just to the left of

West Face

on the Natural Apparatus Boulder, about 4 feet to the right of the tree. Downclimb the low angle face on the north side of the rock.

content.description: Sit start the South corner. Staying on the arete is V5, while easier holds can be had to the left.
content.location: This is on the Southwest face and ascends the right side arete.

content.description:
Start on the lowest two good rails on '

Party Trick

', get a high foot, and dyno to the mid-sized lip. Sweet!
content.location:
Start as for '

Party Trick

on the East face of the Natural Apparatus Boulder.

content.description: Start far right on a solid rail to slopers, then send left to a midway crimp and up right to a mid-sized lip for the crux. From there, move carefully to the top out, and enjoy busting this party trick out in front of your buddies!
content.protection: A pad or two and a solid spot for the first send.
content.location: This is the most instinctive line on the east face of the boulder with numerous bolts and chipped holds on the south side of the rock.

content.description: Climb the clean slab on the northwest side.
content.location: This is on the northwest side.

content.description: Climb the left side of the southwest face following the line of least resistance.
content.location: This is on the southwest face.

content.description:
On the southeast face, persons unknown had too much fun with a drill.

The route consists of 5 drilled finger buckets on a vertical face. The landing is a little dicey because of a large fallen tree, but fear not, there are 3 lead bolts and a 3-bolt anchor protecting this 15-foot pitch. Seriously.
content.protection: 3 bolts with homemade hangers to a 3 bolt anchor with the same.
content.location: This is just right of the Southeast corner, near a large fallen tree.
